description: Latin defatigatus, past participle of defatigare (“to tire or weary”).

adjectives.description: defatigable (comparative more defatigable, superlative most defatigable)

entries.meaning: (very rare) Easily tired or wearied; capable of being fatigued.
examples: The author wishes to acknowledge the help of his peerful editor, Fredrica Friedman, and his defatigable researcher, Susan Hall, as well as that of his severest critic, P. Bear.
